TopicTitle: [.23+] Jeb and Bill 9000, a smaller radial Jeb for the Clarke fans.

Articles.Content: Any notions on making this .17 compatible?

Hmmm... I just want this for the look not what it does :|

Just download it, open the part.cfg file with a word editor, and change the line at the top that says:

module = MuMechJeb

to:

module = Strut

Just download it, open the part.cfg file with a word editor, and change the line at the top that says:

module = MuMechJeb

to:

module = Strut

Thanks a lot!

Any notions on making this .17 compatible?

Works fine in 0.17 for me.

Thanks a lot!

No problem at all!

It's working for me in 0.17, you need to be sure to have the latest MuMechJeb downloaded and installed, though.

Just download it, open the part.cfg file with a word editor, and change the line at the top that says:

module = MuMechJeb

to:

module = Strut

I can use it without any changes.

Maybe the latest version has the changes?

Just download it, open the part.cfg file with a word editor, and change the line at the top that says:

module = MuMechJeb

to:

module = Strut

I endorse this as well
I'm assuming he's getting "not available in this version"

I can use it without any changes.

Maybe the latest version has the changes?

Nah, it just means you have a compatible version of MechJeb. That advise was only for the guy who wanted the Jeb 9000, but not MechJeb.

Does this provide futuristic fried chicken as well?

(HAL : IBM :: JEB : ??? left as an exercise to the reader).
Thanks for the advice guys !

Edited April 26, 2013 by dishycourier

The jeb model has been a staple of mine for ages.. glad to see an update.

As an aside, a good friend of mine who grew up in Nova Scotia went to high school with Bubbles... thrillingly useless fact, I know.

Thank you.

(but I just don't understand why you are having so much trouble with the Spaceport)

I've found two issues with these parts:

1) The capital letter in the folder name 'Textures' inside the zip file makes the part lose its texture on linux, because file names are case-sensitive there.

2) The 'control from here' orientation of the part is upside-down, i.e. if e.g. you put it on the top of a plane or rover, the ground would be in the upper half of the navball.

I've found two issues with these parts:

1) The capital letter in the folder name 'Textures' inside the zip file makes the part lose its texture on linux, because file names are case-sensitive there.

2) The 'control from here' orientation of the part is upside-down, i.e. if e.g. you put it on the top of a plane or rover, the ground would be in the upper half of the navball.

Noted. I'll work on integrating these fixes. I can handle the textures thing, but I'm not sure how to fix control from here. I'll look into it.
I'm loving it, loving it, loving it. Thank you.
